text: You can check batch create if that's what you're looking for.

Hmmm, I have not ever used the marketing events API yet, but I wanted to investigate because someday I might.  What I noticed is if you create the event using the basic endpoint */marketing/v3/marketing-events/events* it does not return the id.  However if you create it with the batch endpoint */marketing/v3/marketing-events/events/upsert* it looks like it does return the id.  Seems like both methods should return it to me but that is what I see in the docs.

Hello! I'm getting an error when trying to connect to the API to update the properties of a contact group. The error is:

`Error updating contacts: {"status":"error","message":"This hapikey does not exist.","correlationId":"604f3c0f-332a-4bbe-bb13-5a16cccd3ff2"}`
Can anybody help me ?

You need to change from using hapi key to access tokens - I don't think you can send it as a query string parameter anymore.

Step 1 is to create a private app inside your HubSpot account. This will generate an Access Token.

Step 2 you will then want to pass your access token inside your headers as the following.

```headers = {
    'accept': "application/json",
    'authorization': f"Bearer {access_token}"
    }```

Thanks, we change it like this:

```port requests
import json

# URL del endpoint para actualizar los contactos
url = "<https://api.hubapi.com/crm/v3/objects/contacts>"

# Convertir cada fila del dataframe merged_df en un diccionario y almacenarlo en una lista
contacts_data = []
for index, row in merged_df.iterrows():
    contact = {
        "vid": str(row['id']),  # identificador del contacto
        "properties": [
            {"property": "campo_de_estudio", "value": row['Campo_de_estudio']},
            {"property": "sector", "value": row['Sector']},
            {"property": "resultados_modelo", "value": row['predictionLabel']}
        ]
    }
    contacts_data.append(contact)

# Convertir los datos a formato JSON
payload = json.dumps(contacts_data)

# Cabeceras de la solicitud
headers = {
    'content-type': "application/json",
    'authorization': f"Bearer {access_token}"
}

# Realizar la solicitud POSTT para actualizar los contactos
response = requests.request("POST",url, headers=headers, data=payload)

# Verificar el estado de la respuesta
if response.status_code == 202:
    print(response.status_code)
    print("Contactos actualizados exitosamente.")
else:
    print("Error al actualizar los contactos:", response.text)```

but i have this error:

```Error al actualizar los contactos: {"status":"error","message":"Invalid input JSON on line 1, column 1: Cannot deserialize value of type `com.HubSpot.inbounddb.publicobject.core.v2.SimplePublicObjectInputForCreate$Json` from Array value (token `JsonToken.START_ARRAY`)","correlationId":"4a2cb69e-259a-4d64-b47e-b3a77367dd76"}```

This error has to do with the json data you are sending.

Are you trying to bulk create multiple contacts?
Yes, I try that
Hello, I have created a private app and I need to get a webhook that notifies me every time a user does a call. Which is the scope / event that will allow it? Thank you
Did you change your endpoint from `<https://api.hubapi.com/contacts/v1/contact/batch/>` to `<https://api.hubapi.com/crm/v3/objects/contacts>`
Should the request be POST or PATCH?
Are you creating or updating contacts?
I think i'll need to run your code locally and see if I can help unblock you

Hey there everyone. Howdy y all?

I am kinda new with using the HubSpot api but it did not used to present this bug.
Can someone give me a headsup?
updating contacts
Thank you! What I'm trying to do is update some properties of a contact group
was there an outage with the site search api recently? Our site search stopped working for several days (despite nothing changing), and now is working again (again, with no fixes made)

```import pandas as pd
import requests
import json

# URL del endpoint para actualizar los contactos
url = "<https://api.hubapi.com/crm/v3/objects/contacts/batch/update>"

merged_df = pd.read_excel("/Users/rginsberg/Downloads/HubSpot-crm-exports-all-contacts-2024-03-05.xlsx")

merged_df = merged_df.fillna("")


# Convertir cada fila del dataframe merged_df en un diccionario y almacenarlo en una lista
contacts_data = []
for index, row in merged_df[0:5].iterrows():
    contact = {
        "id": str(row['Record ID']),  # identificador del contacto
        "properties":
            {"firstname": row['First Name'],
             "email": row['Email'],
             "phone": row['Phone Number']
    }}
    
    contacts_data.append(contact)

# Convertir los datos a formato JSON

payload = {"inputs": contacts_data}

json_payload = json.dumps(payload)


# Cabeceras de la solicitud
headers = {
    'content-type': "application/json",
    'authorization': f"Bearer {access_token}"
}

# Realizar la solicitud POSTT para actualizar los contactos
response = requests.request("POST",url, headers=headers, data=json_payload)

# Verificar el estado de la respuesta
if response.status_code == 200:
    print(response.status_code)
    print(response.content)
    print("Contactos actualizados exitosamente.")
else:
    print("Error al actualizar los contactos:", response.content)```
try this...^

1.) ensured your dataframe doesn't have "Nan" values - replace all "NaNs" with empty string
2.) Changed the structure of the object you are sending to HubSpot
3.) changed the success code from 201 to 200
4.) updated the endpoint to use the batch endpoint for bulk updates
How do I do the latter?

change the first three and I have this error now:

`Error al actualizar los contactos:`
but I don't have the response status code
So url = "<https://api.hubapi.com/crm/v3/objects/contacts/batch/create>" ?

`"status":"error","message":"Invalid input JSON on line 1, column 1: Cannot deserialize value of type `com.HubSpot.inbounddb.publicobject.core.v2.SimplePublicObjectInput$Json` from Array value (token `JsonToken.START_ARRAY`)","correlationId":"6ae00606-6a16-4aa1-ab45-4a82a1fbf244"`
I am getting this error
Did you update this? response = requests.request("POST",url, headers=headers, data=json_payload)
data=json_payload not payload
yes
Please re-copy your current code here

```import requests
import json

# URL del endpoint para actualizar los contactos
url = "<https://api.hubapi.com/crm/v3/objects/contacts/batch/>"

# Convertir cada fila del dataframe merged_df en un diccionario y almacenarlo en una lista
contacts_data = []
for index, row in merged_df.iterrows():
    contact = {
        "vid": str(row['id']),  # Cambia 'vid' por el nombre correcto del identificador del contacto
        "properties": {
            "campo_de_estudio": row['Campo_de_estudio'],  # Asegúrate de que 'Campo_de_estudio' sea un campo válido
            "sector": row['Sector'],  # Asegúrate de que 'Sector' sea un campo válido
            "resultados_modelo": row['predictionLabel']  # Asegúrate de que 'predictionLabel' sea un campo válido
        }
    }
    contacts_data.append(contact)

# Convertir los datos a formato JSON
json_payload = json.dumps(contacts_data)

# Cabeceras de la solicitud
headers = {
    'content-type': "application/json",
    'authorization': f"Bearer token"
}

# Realizar la solicitud PATCH para actualizar los contactos
response = requests.request("POST",url, headers=headers, data=json_payload)

# Verificar el estado de la respuesta
if response.status_code == 200:
    print(response.status_code)
    print("Contactos actualizados exitosamente.")
else:
    print("Error al actualizar los contactos:", response.text)```
See how I have an object with "inputs" and then added the contacts_data array

its missing /update at the end

Hi all,
I have seen that Webhook subscriptions for custom object deletions are not yet supported.
And we are finding a way on how to listen from HubSpot side if there are custom object records being deleted, so that we can update our Member Portal app as well. What do you think is the best way using WF or Custom Coding for this type of use case? Thanks
